channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Fed close to pulling off the elusive economic soft landing in 2024 after great September jobs report
item.description: If this sounds like a Goldilocks scenario, it's probably not far from it, even with the lingering inflation concerns.

item.title: Ubisoft shares skyrocket 33% after report Tencent, Guillemot family considering buyout
item.description: Ubisoft shares surged 33% Friday after a media report that Tencent and the firm's founding Guillemot family are considering a potential buyout of the company.

item.title: Stellantis files federal lawsuit against UAW union over strike threats
item.description: Stellantis is suing the United Auto Workers, escalating a monthslong battle between the trans-Atlantic automaker and American union, CNBC has learned.

item.title: Biden discourages Israel from striking Iran's oil industry, crude posts best week in more than year
item.description: Though oil prices have surged this week on geopolitical tensions, they have risen from a low baseline.

item.title: Jamie Dimon denies Trump's claim that JPMorgan CEO has endorsed him
item.description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon previously urged corporate leaders to back Nikki Haley over Donald Trump. Trump faces Vice President Kamala Harris in November.

item.title: Rivian shares fall after EV maker slashes production forecast, misses Q3 delivery expectations
item.description: Rivian produced 13,157 vehicles at its manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois, and delivered 10,018 vehicles during the same period.

item.title: Mortgage rates spike after stronger-than-expected jobs report
item.description: The average rate on the 30-year fixed mortgage is now 6.53% according to Mortgage News Daily.

item.title: As Apple enters AI race, iPhone maker turns to its army of developers for an edge
item.description: As Apple prepares Apple Intelligence to jump into tech's AI race, it's relying on one of its strongest advantages: Its army of 34 million app developers.

item.title: Young Chinese are 'retiring' in the countryside as China's unemployment woes grate
item.description: China's youths are retreating to the countryside after getting fired from their jobs, or unable to secure one that they are content with.

item.title: A private island for $1,000 per night — for those who are willing to get there
item.description: Pinang Island is a rustic eco-resort that opened two years ago in Indonesia. But traveling to the remote island often requires three flights and a boat ride.

item.title: European Union votes to impose tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles
item.description: European Union member states on Friday voted in favor of the European Commission's proposal to impose definitive tariffs on battery electric vehicles from China.

item.title: Maersk slumps 5% as the end of U.S. port strikes weighs on European shipping stocks
item.description: Shares of Moller-Maersk slumped more than 8% Friday as European shipping companies fell on the conclusion of a U.S. port strike.

item.title: Satellite imagery shows Iranian oil tankers at country’s major terminal disappearing amid fears of Israeli counterattack
item.description: Fifteen miles off Iran's northwestern coast, the Kharg Island terminal handles more than 90% of the country's crude exports.

item.title: Why oil prices haven't skyrocketed on Middle East supply fears — yet
item.description: Energy analysts have questioned whether oil markets are being too complacent about the risk of a widening conflict in the Middle East.

item.title: Britain's defense sector vies for stretched government funding on path to 2.5%
item.description: British defense officials are vying to secure more funding as Finance Minister Rachel Reeves' upcoming Autumn budget.

item.title: Singapore court charges property billionaire Ong Beng Seng over scandal involving former minister
item.description: A court filing said he was due to face two counts, related to the obstruction of justice and abetment.

item.title: Goldman Sachs says crude could spike by $20 on Iran oil shock
item.description: Oil prices could shoot up $20 per barrel if Iranian production sees a hit, said Goldman Sachs.

item.title: Japan PM Shigeru Ishiba asks ministers to craft economic relief package to cushion inflation impact
item.description: During his campaign, Ishiba vowed to reduce the burden on households suffering from rising living costs and showed intentions to boost rural revitalization.

item.title: China's stimulus rally has already sent stocks up 25%. And there could be more to come
item.description: Mainland markets is closed for a week-long holiday commemorating the 75th anniversary of the People's Republic of China. Trading is set to resume on Oct. 8.

item.title: Hong Kong markets resume rally as investors weigh China stimulus, oil gains
item.description: Asia-Pacific markets traded mixed on Friday, though Hong Kong's Hang Seng index is up over 2%, resuming its rally.

item.title: Starlink to end the days of spotty Wi-Fi on planes, says Air New Zealand CEO
item.description: Reliable and fast Wi-Fi will become "ubiquitous" on full-service carriers, Greg Foran told CNBC's "Squawk Box Asia" Friday.

item.title: U.S. crude oil jumps as Biden comments on possible Israel retaliation against Iran
item.description: Supply disruption risks are increasing as fighting in the Middle East intensifies, according to analysts.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg is now world's second-richest person, ahead of Jeff Bezos
item.description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has surpassed Jeff Bezos as the world's richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

item.title: Japan still expected to stick to hiking cycle despite PM Ishiba's dovish turn
item.description: Japanese currency experts are not budging from their Bank of Japan rate policy expectations even as the yen falls.

item.title: Here's everything to expect when the September jobs report is released Friday
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls are projected to show growth of 150,000, form 142,000 the month before, with a steady unemployment rate of 4.2%.

item.title: U.S. bans Chinese firms in Uyghur region as Beijing fights forced labor claims
item.description: The U.S. has added two new Chinese companies to Xinjiang trade blacklist one week after Beijing launched a retaliation against forced labor claims.

item.title: Sterling plunges more than 1% against the dollar, euro after Bank of England governor's comments on rates
item.description: Sterling was down 1.27% to $1.3098 at 12:30 p.m. in London.

item.title: European markets close 1% lower as investors focus on Middle East escalation
item.description: European stocks closed lower Thursday as conflict in the Middle East weighed on regional investor sentiment.

item.title: Klarna CEO says a European tech brain drain is ‘number one risk’ for company ahead of IPO
item.description: Klarna boss Sebastian Siemiatkowski said unfavorable share-based compensation rules in Europe could cause employees to flock to U.S. tech companies.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: The 'sticky' outsourcing firms on the rise
item.description: Inside India looks at the growing trend in outsourcing research and development to India, and how India will fabricate its first microchip in two years.
